biogHist.p: Peter John Murphy was born in 1930 in Montreal, Quebec. After graduating high school in Montreal he attended McGill University for two years before transferring to the University of New Brunswick to study forestry and graduated from UNB in 1953 with a B.Sc. in Forestry. Upon graduation he worked for the British Columbia Forestry service for a year before moving to the Alberta Forestry service as a forest engineer. In 1955, he joined the Eastern Rockies Forest Conservation Board in Calgary before returning to the Alberta Forestry service as forester in charge of the New Training Branch. Through his position, Dr. Murphy played an active role in the establishment of the Forest Technology School at Hinton in 1960 and the creation of a cooperative forest technology program with the Northern Alberta Institute of Technology in 1965. While on educational leave in 1962-1963, he completed a M.Sc. in Forestry at the University of Montana. In 1973, he joined the Department of Forest Science at the University of Alberta, was appointed Acting Chairman of the Department in 1974, and Chairman in 1975. Dr. Murphy was appointed Associate Dean- Forestry in 1978. In ca. 1985, Dr. Murphy completed a Ph. D. program at the University of British Columbia. Dr. Murphy's research interests include forest fire management policies and forest history and he has published numerous articles and several monographs on several forestry related topics. Dr. Murphy was named a Professor Emeritus of the University of Alberta upon his retirement in 1994.
